image.title: World News, Today World News, Latest International News, World Breaking News, Trending News of World - Times of India

item.title: Hurricane Erick: Category 3 storm nears Mexico; southern states on high alert
item.description: Hurricane Erick, a Category 3 storm, is nearing Mexico's southern Pacific coast, posing threats of destructive winds and flash floods. Oaxaca, Guerrero, and Chiapas are on high alert, with residents urged to seek shelter. Acapulco, still recovering from Hurricane Otis, is taking extra precautions.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Middle East crisis: Putin proposes peace talks between Iran and Israel; Trump tells him to focus on Ukraine first
item.description: Amid escalating Middle East tensions, Vladimir Putin offered Russia's mediation between Iran and Israel, citing Moscow's unique ties. He revealed proposals shared with Iran, Israel, and the U.S. for de-escalation. While Trump dismissed the offer, Putin highlighted Russia's nuclear cooperation with Iran, assuring Israel of security measures.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I have plan for everything': Trump doesn’t confirm strike on Iran; but leaves options open
item.description: Amid escalating conflict between Israel and Iran, US president Donald Trump remains ambiguous about potential military action against Iran. He stated having “a plan for everything” but offered no specifics, hinting at possible future talks while emphasising Iran's past rejection of a deal. Tehran faces severe consequences with Israeli airstrikes, deserted streets, disrupted services.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Drunk woman dragged off Southwest flight in New York; watch video
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Two big nuclear powers avoided war': Donald Trump on meeting with Asim Munir; says trade talks on with India, Pakistan
item.description: US President Donald Trump claimed credit for preventing a war between India and Pakistan, citing the influence of Pakistan's Army Chief General Asim Munir. Trump stated he thanked Munir for "ending" the conflict. He also mentioned ongoing trade deal discussions with both India and Pakistan, following recent talks with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Irish group Kneecap appears in UK court; charged with terror offence over Hezbollah flag; hundreds rally in support outside courthouse
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian-American professor slammed for blaming 'reservation' for Air India crash: 'Freeloaders are more important'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Regime could fall': Donald Trump says no decision yet on joining Israel in bombing Iran; warns 'anything could happen'
item.description: President Trump has not decided on joining Israel in strikes against Iran, but suggested the regime could collapse. He hinted at potential US action regarding Iran's nuclear facilities, stating a turning point might be near. These remarks follow heightened tensions and Israeli strikes on Iranian sites, fueling speculation about broader conflict.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Karen Read 'NOT GUILTY' of murdering police officer boyfriend John O'Keefe
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US Supreme Court upholds Tennessee ban on transgender youth care; major blow to trans rights; paves way for similar laws in 26 states
item.description: The US Supreme Court has upheld Tennessee's ban on gender-affirming care for transgender minors, a decision with potential implications for similar laws across 26 other states. This 6-3 ruling, backed by the Trump administration's efforts to restrict medical treatments for transgender youth, allows the state's restrictions to remain in place.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: New visa restrictions: US bars foreign officials who help illegal, mass immigration
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Easing back into public life': Kate Middleton pulls out of Royal Ascot last minute; continues gradual return after cancer battle
item.description: Princess Kate Middleton, still prioritizing her health and recovery from cancer treatment, regrettably withdrew from attending Royal Ascot on Wednesday. Despite initial confirmation, Kensington Palace announced her absence, with Prince William joining King Charles and Queen Camilla in the first carriage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'If I go back...': Pakistani-origin activist Shoaib Sohail says UK will deport him as he supports Tommy Robinson
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nobel peace prize for Trump? US President gets nominated by Asim Munir
item.description: Donald Trump claimed to have prevented a war between India and Pakistan, coinciding with his meeting with Pakistan's army chief, Asim Munir. This occurred shortly after Narendra Modi informed Trump that a ceasefire was achieved through military talks, not U.S. mediation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Every 30th adult now a millionare: UAE adds 13,000 dollar millionaires in 2024
item.description: In 2024, the UAE added 13,000 new millionaires, pushing the total to over 240,000. With $785 billion in private wealth, the country has become the second-fastest-growing millionaire market after Türkiye. A surge in financial migration and strong investment inflows highlight the UAE’s growing appeal as a global hub for high-net-worth individuals.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US on Iran: Not Pete Hegseth, 'Gorilla' Erik Kurilla is calling the shots on Middle East crisis
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Wayne Gretzky opens up about how his father tried to stop nickname from sticking
item.description: Wayne Gretzky's iconic nickname, 'The Great One,' faced initial resistance from his father, Walter. Despite concerns about pressure, the name stuck as Gretzky dominated youth hockey. He later embraced it, exceeding expectations with a record-breaking NHL career. Gretzky also commented on the Edmonton Oilers' recent loss to the Florida Panthers. His journey reflects humility, brilliance, and lasting greatness in hockey.
item.dc:creator: TOI Sports Desk

item.title: 'Only God can help us': Indian mountaineer stranded on US mountain; sends SOS message
item.description: Shaikh Hasan Khan, an Indian mountaineer from Kerala, is stranded with his team on Denali Mountain in North America after encountering a severe storm at 17,000 feet. He sent an SOS message via satellite phone, reporting dwindling food and water supplies.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Iran made a mistake': Donald Trump responds to Khamenei's refusal to surrender; says 'good luck'
item.description: Amid escalating tensions between Iran and Israel, former US President Donald Trump has sharply criticized Iran, stating they "made a mistake." This response follows Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's vow against surrender and warning of severe consequences if the US intervenes.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict: This number could define the outcome - The missile math explained
item.description: The escalating conflict between Iran and Israel hinges on Iran's remaining medium-range ballistic missiles (MRBMs). After firing approximately 700 MRBMs, estimates place Iran's remaining stockpile between 300 and 1,300. Damage to Iranian infrastructure and missile production capabilities, coupled with potential foreign support, further complicates the situation, potentially forcing Iran into negotiations or escalation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
